age package#

age.model module#

Bone Age Assessment Model and Utilities

This Python script encompasses the definition of a Bone Age Assessment model and utility functions for its preparation, training, evaluation, and visualization. Here’s a breakdown of its key components:

  1. Importing Libraries

    The script imports various libraries necessary for deep learning model creation, data processing, and visualization, including os, numpy, pandas, matplotlib, and keras.

  2. BoneAgeAssessment Class

    The BoneAgeAssessment class provides methods for data preparation, model training, evaluation, and visualization. Key attributes include paths to data directories, data frames for training, validation, and test data, image size, batch size, options, and weights directory. Methods include:

    • preparation: Prepare data generators for training, validation, or test.

    • compiler: Compile the model with specified learning rate.

    • callbacks: Get a list of callbacks for model training.

    • loader: Load pre-trained weights into the model.

    • fitter: Train the model and return training history.

    • get_attention_map_model: Get a sub-model for visualizing attention maps.

    • visualize_attention_map: Visualize attention maps for a given image.

    • training_evaluation: Evaluate and visualize the training process.

    • model_evaluation: Evaluate the model on the test set.

  3. Model Class

    The Model class provides methods for creating different variations of the Bone Age Assessment model using the VGG16 architecture. Key attributes include the input size of the model and a flag to show the model summary. Methods include model variations such as vgg16regression, vgg16regression_atn, vgg16regression_atn_l1, and vgg16regression_atn_l2.

  4. Statistics Functions

    • r_squared: Calculate Pearson correlation coefficient.

    • mean_absolute_error: Calculate Mean Absolute Error.

    • mean_absolute_deviation: Calculate Mean Absolute Deviation.

class age.model.BaaModel(input_size: tuple = (399, 399, 3), summ: bool = True)[source]#

Bases: object

Class for Bone Age Assessment model creation.

This class provides methods for creating different variations of the Bone Age Assessment model using VGG16 architecture.

Attributes:

input_size (tuple): Input size of the model. summ (bool): Flag to show model summary.

Methods:
vgg16regression() -> keras.Model:

Create a simplified VGG16 regression model.

vgg16regression_l2(reg_factor: float) -> keras.Model:

Create VGG16 regression model with L2 regularization.

Returns:

Create VGG16 regression model with L2 regularization.

Args:

reg_factor (float): Regularization factor.

Returns:

keras.Model: VGG16 regression model.

class age.model.BoneAgeAssessment(image_size: tuple = (399, 399), batch_size: tuple = (32, 32, 1396), epochs: int = 20, lr: float = 1e-05, balanced: bool = True)[source]#

Bases: object

Class for Bone Age Assessment model.

This class provides methods for data preparation, model training, evaluation, and visualization.

Attributes:

  • main (str): Path to the boneageassessment directory.

  • baa (str): Path to the baa directory.

  • IMAGES (str): Path to the images directory.

  • labels (str): Path to the labels directory.

  • processed (str): Path to the processed data directory.

  • train (str): Path to the training data directory.

  • train_df (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame containing training data.

  • validation (str): Path to the validation data directory.

  • validation_df (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame containing validation data.

  • test (str): Path to the test data directory.

  • test_df (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame containing test data.

  • image_size (tuple): Size of the input images.

  • batch_size (tuple): Batch size for training, validation, and test.

  • opts (list): List of allowed options.

  • weights (str): Path to the directory for storing model weights.

Methods:
  • update_batch_size(new_batch_size: tuple):

    Update the batch size for training, validation, and test.

Train the model and return training history without callbacks.

model_evaluation(training: bool = True, weight: str | None = None)[source]#

Evaluate the model on the test set.

Args:

training (bool): if True, load the just trained model. Else load the weight specified by the input path. weight (str, optional): Name of the pre-trained weight file.

prediction(image: ndarray, show: bool = False, save: bool = True, image_id: int = 0) → float[source]#

Make prediction on an image and visualize the result.

Args:

image (np.ndarray): The input image array. show (bool, optional): Whether to display the prediction plot. Defaults to True. save (bool, optional): Whether to save the prediction plot. Defaults to True. image_id (int, optional): Identifier for the image. Defaults to 0.

Returns:

float: Predicted age.

age.model.lr_scheduler(epoch, initial_lr=0.0001, decay_rate=0.95)[source]#

Learning rate schedule function with exponential decay.

Parameters:

epoch (int): Current epoch number. initial_lr (float, optional): Initial learning rate. Defaults to 1e-04. decay_rate (float, optional): Rate of decay. Defaults to 0.95.

Returns:

float: Updated learning rate.
